p: In sub-Saharan Africa, venue-based and respondent-driven sampling strategies are commonly used to characterize key populations for whom there is no practical sampling frame. Venue-based sampling focuses on settings where key populations congregate, while respondent-driven sampling leverages networks of people sharing risk characteristics [ 31- 33]. Although widely used in Africa, these approaches have not to date received the same level of attention as national-level general population surveys.
